meanings.definition: A person who kidnaps or tricks someone into working on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The shanghaier lured unsuspecting sailors onto the ship.
meanings.sent2: The captain was wary of the shanghaier lurking in the port.
meanings.sent3: The shanghaier's hat flew off as he chased after the sailors.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the shanghaier's smooth talk, like a siren's song leading you astray.
meanings.sent5: The shanghaier's shadow stretched long across the dock, a sinister figure in the night.

meanings.definition: To kidnap or trick someone into working on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The pirates tried to shanghaier the crew for their own ship.
meanings.sent2: He shanghaiered the young man by promising adventure at sea.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous sailor shanghaiered his friend as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The storm shanghaiered the ship, pulling it into the raging sea.
meanings.sent5: Her words shanghaiered him into a world of uncertainty and doubt.
